data.title: Delicious breakfast any time of the day!
data.text:
Enjoyed a free birthday Grand Slam breakfast, which was very filling and nicely-prepared with 4 choices on the plate.  Coffee was deliciously hot.  One of our party chose an early lunch instead, and that looked equally delicious!
Our waiter, Chris, was super attentive and excellent!

data.title: Great Service
data.text: My Father eats here almost everyday and is treated like family. The manager, hostess, and staff go out of their way to accommodate their customers. I noticed this treatment was extended to everybody eating here. The menu is standard for Denny's, however the cooks did an excellent job ensuring it was prepared in a above average manner (compared to other Denny's). Decor is not everything in a restaurant. If you want a good meal in a very friendly atmosphere, this is the place to eat.

data.title: Outdated and Nothing Special
data.text: The only reason I go to Denny's is that our Class of '69 has a weekly breakfast from 6:00 - 8:00.  For many years we have met in the banquet room just to the left when you enter the restaurant.  It is basically ratty.  The men's restroom is atrocious.  It seems obvious that the Denny's home office doesn't care about this facility.  It is located in an outstanding location directly across Texas Avenue from Texas A&M University.  That should be enough incentive for this place to maintain a premier business, but they don't.  It's disappointing.  The food is only so-so for most dishes.  I have become ill more than once after eating breakfast there.  If it weren't for our class breakfast each week, I would not set foot in there.  I've eaten in several Denny's restaurants all over, and this one is on the bottom of my list.

data.title: Got Really Sick After Breakfast Today
data.text: I join my Class of '69 Texas A&M classmates each Friday morning for breakfast, fun and fellowship.  On more than one occasion, I have been hit with sudden diarrhea soon after leaving there, barely making it to a restroom in time.  This morning was probably my fourth or fifth time to experience the same thing three times before noon.  I'm sorry if this comes across as TMI for you, but it is the truth.  Even though I will miss meeting with my classmates, I'm done with the Denny's across from the University.  I am going to report them to the Brazos County Health Department to be inspected.

data.title: Horrible coffee!
data.text: Went for a late brunch on a Sunday. 20 min wait due to what looked like a leak that had them block off 3 or 4 booths along the front wall. Service & food were fine but the coffee was horrendous. The first cup was slightly bitter & not what we were used to but was drinkable. Our server mentioned they were making a fresh pot so when he came back by we got a refill. It was undrinkable. It was way too strong & bitter as tree bark. I don't know if it was the brand or the person making it. On a side note, they were mopping the floors with some horrible smelling, definitely unappetizing, cleaner that was seriously overpowering. Please make some changes Denny!

data.title: Modern American diner
data.text: If you are looking to get a taste of the old American diner experience, Denny's is one of the best places. Their omelettes are soft, fluffy and stuffed with fresh ingredients. Their pancakes are delicious and something my kids always look forward to enjoy!

data.title: Breakfadt
data.text: Very busy at breakfast time, but after a short wait we were called to our table. Huge choice of breakfasts, food and service very good and free coffee refills, sets you up for the day.

data.title: Great meal
data.text: Love their specials, that is the neat things about specials you can try new things without going broke.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: My choice was to eat free at LaQuinta's or pay for breakfast at Denny's.  I chose to pay after having LaQuinta breakfast yesterday (blah). It was actually pretty good and more than filling. The coffee was OK, but not very strong and the omelette was perfect with red potatoes.  So, good place to eat.

data.title: It's Denny's...
data.text:
Stopped in for breakfast about 8 AM on a Saturday morning. Our server was fast, friendly, and efficient, and we always had coffee and water refills. I had the four cheese omelet, and it was served hot and tasted fresh. Great with salsa.

The restaurant was clean and the service and food were good. Denny's offers a 15% percent discount for AARP members.

data.title: good food, good staff
data.text: food was good people polite. they say i have say more so okay MORE MORE MORE MORE MORE MORE MORE MORE MORE

data.title: Denny's in Aggieland
data.text: We had eaten here before and service was not that good. This time we had a very pleasant server but restaurant was busy and she had a lot of tables. Our tea didn't have enough ice and we had to ask for silverware. My salad was okay but not memorable. I think we will wait a while before we fo back. Restaurant was noisy.

data.title: choose a better
data.text: This Denny's is well in need of a total facelift. Run down, dirty filthy carpet, dull lighting. Has a GOOD location to college, busy street. However, under staffed. Did not see real any teamwork. The staff tries hard, howver with limited help, the place suffers. expect long wait, no attention; maybe Denny's will improve this location soon.

data.title: Still in the 20th Century
data.text: The Denny's restaurant in College Station is located in one of the most desirable locations in town.  Yet, it has continual management turnover, is in DIRE need of maintenance and remodeling.  The service is generally good, and the food is generally good, but it is absolutely not a pleasant dining environment.  The banquet room is a total disgrace.  The restrooms are basically no better than a military latrine.  Lighting in the parking lot is insufficient at night.  In short it is just a business without regard to the general public.  If there was ever a huge need in this town, it is for a great place to enjoy breakfast.  The places to do so are very limited.  This is a potential gold mine sitting across from the University, but it seems that corporate is oblivious to that.  I go there once a week due to a Class of '69 breakfast.  Otherwise, I would not go there.

data.title: If you love waiting forever for horrible food, come here!
data.text: The food is atrocious. The service is lacking. They have one chef it looks like because it takes forever to get food. Went here for graduation dinner, and 4 us waited 1.5 hrs for food. During that time our servers never bother checking regularly. Drinks weren't topped off. Once we got the food, it was horrible. Fish was over cooked, my skillet looked like someone had eaten half of it already. I mean cmon, don't make me wait that long to serve such crap. Never going back.

data.title: Great service
data.text: Food was great, the staff friendly, a very large and clean restaurant. Right across the street from Texas A&M University.

data.title: Waiting for Everything
data.text:
I went here for a breakfast before work.  Despite the number of cars in the parking lot, the restaurant itself was not crowded.  I was acknowledged quickly, and was told "I'll be right with you", which was 5 minutes later.  I was then seated quickly and ordered almost immediately.  It took 15 minutes to get the food served, and at this point I just had to wolf everything down to (hopefully) make it to work on time.  I had the red-white-and blue breakfast.  It was okay enough.  The bacon pieces were small and thin.

While rushing to finish the meal, one of the staff mentioned having a "brain fart".  Something I don't want to hear while eating is the word "fart", no matter what comes before it.

After finishing my meal, I had to wait another 5 minutes to get the check, and yet another 5 minutes for a cashier to come by the front so I could pay.  I seriously thought of bolting without pay since staff was nowhere around.

Needless to say, I was late for work.

Food was okay, service was pretty inattentive, and slow.

data.title: Great place, great service
data.text: We go for breakfast at least once a week at this Denny's. Staff knows you and is proactive in getting your drinks. They treat you like family. You can't go wrong with their breakfast menu and meal values. Sign up at Dennys.com to get coupons. One of my favorite places in this town! We took 17 people to Dennys after high school graduation--awesome, everyone got what they wanted and hot. Amazing service.

data.title: Duh, it's Denny's
data.text: Local staff very friendly, but the menu is classic Denny's; so-so quality and portions.  And if you drink anything other than water, you'll pay as much as a better restaurant.

data.title: Great food and great service.
data.text: You know for a Denny's in a college town this location is great! A lot of people who write bad reviews seem to forget that College Station is student based and that being said you have to expect to get some lazy careless servers. You get it anywhere in B/CS so just keep that in mind. But I've ate at this Denny's several times and I must say that things have been turning around lately and much less of the times coming in there when they have the less than top servers working.
